Class UsefulMethodsForGraphs

  • java.lang.Object
    • UsefulMethodsForGraphs

  • public class UsefulMethodsForGraphs
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to implement useful methods for Graph class.

      static boolean isAcyclicGraph(Graph graph)
      Checks if graph contains any cycle.

      Determine the if there is any path between vertex1 and verex2 in the graph.
      static boolean isUndirected(Graph graph)
      Checks if the graph is undirected, this is true if all directed edges have a complementary directed edge with the same weight in opposite direction.

      Plot showing all vertices(labeled) and edges.
      static Path shortestPath(Graph graph, int vertex1, int vertex2)

                                  int vertex1,
                                  int vertex2)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Determine the if there is any path between vertex1 and verex2 in the graph.
        Parameters:
        graph - A Graph Object
        vertex1 - vertex label in graph
        vertex2 - vertex label int graph
        Returns:
        true if there is a part from vertex 1 vertex2, false if not
        Throws:

        Returns:
        true if g is undirected, false if not

      • shortestPath

        public static Path shortestPath(Graph graph,
                                int vertex1,
                                int vertex2)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Find the shortest path from vertex 1 to vertex2 using Dijkstra’s algorithm.
        Parameters:
        graph - A Graph object
        vertex1 - vertex label in Graph
        vertex2 - vertex label 2 in Graph
        Returns:
        A path between vertex1 and vertex2
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if vertex 1 or vertex2 is not in the graph
